publicationStmt.p: Mary Anne Rawson's The Bow in the Cloud (1834): A Scholarly Edition

sourceDesc.p: Published in The Bow in the Cloud; or, The Negro's Memorial. A Collection of Original Contributions in Prose and Verse, Illustrative of the Evils of Slavery, and Commemorative of its Abolition in the British Colonies. London: Jackson & Walford, 1834, p. 232.

div.p: The Committee of West-Indian Proprietors have agreed to present to the Marquis of Chandos, their Chairman, a splendid Gold Cup, in token of gratitude for his exertions in retarding the progress of Slave-Emancipation. The following is respectfully submitted as an appropriate Inscription for the same, by S. C. Hall.

lg.l: Behold this Cup! -- this Cup of Gold!
That freemen to a freeman gave!
Formed at rich cost, -- a price untold!
Nay, start not ere the stream be quaff'd,
